utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! What are you guys looking at?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, it’s a poster for that World War I movie that I’m in, check it out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah? Wow! It looks really violent!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-huh! I know. I’m coming soon to a theater near you! I’m in THX! I’m unsuitable for children!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now I cannot wait to see this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, it’s already generating Oscar buzz.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I started that!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I thought I did! Oh hey guess what? The premiere is next week and you’re all invited!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are we gonna take a limo?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sure! Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh I love taking limos when nobody died!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well obviously I won’t be able to come, for those of you who haven’t checked their calendars today is my due date. Well y’know, I just want to take a moment and thank you guys for how great you’ve been during this time. I really couldn’t have done it without you. And I have loved these last nine months! And even though I am so looking forward to the next part, I am really gonna miss being pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s right, still no baby! Come on people! Please make some room!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh sweetie, maybe you’d be more comfortable here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You. Like you haven’t done enough.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I-I know how miserable you are, I wish there was something I can do. I mean I wish I were a seahorse. Because with seahorses it’s the male, they carry the babies. And then also umm, I’d be far away in the sea.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God. I have never been so uncomfortable in my entire life!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh I know, I’ve been there. I remember toward the end…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Phoebe, that’s a great story. Can you tell it to me when you’re getting me some iced tea? Oh God, get out! Get out!! Get out!! Get out!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let’s.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Did you have the baby yet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you want me to come over there and sit on you? ‘Cause I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you doing here so early?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They sent me home from work. They were like, "Start your maternity leave now! Just rest, get ready for the baby." Well y’know what? Screw ‘em! If they don’t want me there, I’ll just hang out with you guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Or you can do volunteer work.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Joey! It’s Estelle! Great news, I was able to get you and one guest tickets to your premiere.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: One guest? You told me I can have six tickets!

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Well, I sold four of them on Ebay. You’ll be sitting next to HotGuy372.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God. So that’s it?! I only get to bring one guest?

utterance.speaker: Estelle
utterance.content: Yeah, what time do you wanna pick me up? Hello?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Did you hear that? I only get one extra ticket to my premiere. So some how I have to pick between you three and Ross.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What-what about me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You said you didn’t want to go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t. But I would still like to be acknowledged. What? Just because I’m pregnant you think I’m invisible.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Definitely not invisible.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, well Ross didn’t care enough to be here, so I think he’s out. You snooze you lose.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He’s not snoozing, he’s teaching a class.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well then somebody’s snoozing. Joey, not that this uh should affect you at all, but if you were to pick me, I was planning on wearing a sequined dress, cut down to here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I haven’t seen this dress.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Star in a movie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Joey, you pick who ever you want. Okay? You just listen to your heart. What does it tell you? Phoebe, Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well uh…I think I want to take Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe-Phoebe—Burrrrr!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You really want to take me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! I mean I’m sorry, I wish I can take everybody, but y’know Chandler always supported my career. He’s paid for acting classes and head shots and stuff and well this will be my way of paying you back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you’re never actually going to pay me back?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, just because he paid for your head shots you’re gonna take him? Joey, I don’t think you’re comprehending just how slutty this dress is!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s not just the stuff he paid for, I mean it’s-it’s everything. Y’know? He read lines with me. He-he went with me on auditions when I was really nervous, and then he consoled me after I didn’t get parts that I really wanted. You always believed in me man. Even, even when I didn’t believe in myself.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I always knew you were gonna make it. I’m so proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks. That means a lot to me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mon, maybe one of these guys wants to wear your dress.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m gonna go shave.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m gonna go spit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I have to pee. If I don’t come out in five minutes it’s because I’ve choked to death on the potpourri stink.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: When she comes out, you hold her nose, I’ll blow in her mouth, and the kid will just right out of her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s over a week late! She gotta have it today, right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know. I-I think it’s still gonna be a while.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmm, care to make it interesting? I’ll bet you that she’ll have it by this time tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, how much?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: One hundred thousand dollars!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How about fifty bucks?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine! I’ll call Zurich and move some money around.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, who’s turn is it to help me get up!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No one’s here! Oh damnit!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is so exciting! It’s so glamorous! People taking our picture. How do I look?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A little tall.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you mind crouching down a little bit, so that I look taller? There you go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s just so glamorous.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hey Mon? Rach is here! Ohh, you’re still pregnant. Oh, I’m sorry. I know how uncomfortable you are. Y’know what? You look great. Yeah, like fifty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I have to go pee. Apparently this baby thinks that my bladder is a squeeze toy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Damnit! Damnit!! Here’s your fifty bucks!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s interesting that you lost. Now, I forget, do you like to lose?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now stop it! Double or nothing that she has it by tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine! You’re on!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Until then, General Grant, why don’t you set up camp right there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey is Rachel here? We have a doctor’s appointment.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She’s in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, we gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: In a minute!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: People ask me why we’re not together, I just don’t know what to tell them.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, all right. Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, do you wanna go change first? The doctor’s keeping the office open late for us, but if you hurry…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really? You don’t think that’s a little inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good God man don’t anger it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, it is 100 degrees outside. For the first time in weeks, I am somewhat comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine! Fine! Y’know what? Whatever you want. Okay? You’re the mommy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh uh-uh pal! Don’t call me mommy! It’s bad enough you call your own mother that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m actually with her on this one.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "I thought I knew who the enemy was, but it was you all along."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, this is it. It’s my big fight scene coming up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When Carol was pregnant with Ben…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mmm?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …were you this irritating?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Excuse me?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh nothing. Nothing! Just uh, you’ve been a little short with me lately. I’m not trying to irritate you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well then you just must have a natural talent for it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what? The doctor will be in soon, why don’t we not speak until then.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Seriously, breathe louder Ross! That’s great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know we should probably ask the doctor if she even knows how to deliver a baby that’s half human and half pure evil!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi Dr. Long, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you’re nice to her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She has the drugs!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: We’ll do a quick check.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: So, eight days late huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: You must be a little uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eh, just a tad.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: You’re about 80 percent effaced, so you’re on your way. It still could last a little while longer. If you’re anxious there are a few ways to help things along.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do them!!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: Actually, they’re things you can do. Just some home remedies, but in my experience I’ve found that some of them are quite effective.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, we are ready to try anything.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: Okay, there’s an herbal tea you can drink.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: You can take some caster oil, there’s eating spicy foods…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Great! We will do all of those.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: …taking a long walk, and then there’s the one that’s proved most effective: sex.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Good job Joe! Well done! Top notch!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You liked it? You really liked it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-ho-ho, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Which part exactly?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The whole thing! Can we go?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, give me some specifics.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love the specifics, the specifics were the best part!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, what about the scene with the kangaroo? Did-did you like that part?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I was surprised to see a kangaroo in a World War I epic.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You fell asleep!! There was no kangaroo! They didn’t take any of my suggestions! That’s for coming buddy. I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t go! I’m sorry. I’m so sorry! Look! This guy fell asleep! He fell asleep too! Be mad at him! Or, call an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What did the doctor say? Any news on when the baby will come?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. But she did give us some ideas on how to induce labor.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, we tried them all. We went for a walk, uh we tried a special tea, caster oil, spicy food nothing has worked.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, there is one thing that we haven’t tried, but someone thinks that, "That will open up a can of worms."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well what is it? What is it? If it’s gonna help bring the baby here, like today. I mean, I think you should do it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s sex.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m just saying it’s been a really long time for you. I mean, women have needs. Do it, get yours!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh I-I don’t know about that. No, I think that if the two of you had sex the-the-the repercussions would be catastrophic.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, let’s be practical, if Ross isn’t willing to do it, he’s not the only guy in the world you can have sex with. You can borrow Chandler—Chandler is good!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica, what is the matter with you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing. I just want the baby to be born today.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? Why today?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay fine! I keep betting Phoebe that you’re gonna have the baby and I don’t want to lose again!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! While she’s been going through this hell, you’ve been making money?! You’re betting on your friend staying in this misery?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ll take that bet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I’m miserable here! I might as well make some money out it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can I get some of that action?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute! Now I’m betting against all three of you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey, don’t worry. I really do feel like tomorrow’s the day.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, okay!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Sleeping beauty!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where have you been?! I tried to call you! I want to talk to you! I still feel so bad!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no, were you upset? Did you lose sleep?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-huh look, the only reason I can over here was to settle things between us! Okay? You’ve done a lot for me and my career, I wanted to pay you back so I took you to the premiere but you missed it! Okay, so how much do I owe you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Give me a number, I don’t want to owe you anything!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t owe me anything, I don’t want you money…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah-ah-ah! We’re doing this! Okay, now you got me my first set of head shots. Right, how much were those?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know, five hundred dollars?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, five hundred dollars. What else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well then there was the second set, the infamous booger head shots.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, so that’s another five hundred. Five hundred and five hundred, that’s…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you want a calculator?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Please!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, what else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well uh, there was acting classes, stage combat classes, tap classes…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Which we’re still keeping under our hats!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh then there was that dialect coach who helped you with that play where you needed a southern accent. Which after twenty hours of lessons still came out Jamaican.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What the hell are you talking about, "The south will rise again man."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, money well spent!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay, what else? Rent!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, two, three years of rent, utilities, food…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, so I’m writing you a check for…So you fell asleep during my movie. Big deal right? How do you clear this thing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, finish your enchilada.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross I—We tried all the spicy food. It’s not working.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay here, have one of these peppers. Oh ha… Oh God! So…so hot! Oh my— By the way, you don’t want to touch the pepper and then touch your eye.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am feeling nothing. Speaking of hot, watching you do that really makes me want to have sex with you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Stop it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come on Ross, why are we wasting our time with this other stuff?! We know what’s gonna work! It’s doctor recommended!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but we have to have some boundaries! My God, I’m dying.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come on Ross, we’ve done it before we’ll do it again, it’ll be a nice way to bookend the pregnancy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is insane, I’m not gonna make love to you just so that you’ll go into labor.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Make love? What are you a girl?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Always a great way to get in a man’s pants.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But you will, you will be performing a service. Okay? Just-just think of me as a ketchup bottle, y’know you sometimes you have to bang on the end of it just to get something to come out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I love when you talk dirty to me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I know it. You’re right. That’s not sexy. Oh…Oh! Whoops! Oh, I seem to have dropped my fork. Let me just bed over and get it. Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay enough! This is, this is not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on Ross! I’m miserable here! Come on! You started this, now you finish it! Come on wuss, make love to me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow! What now Ross you’re not gonna talk? How on earth will you ever annoy me? Oh wait a minute, I know. I mean you’d think the damn jalepeno would’ve cleared up your sinuses, but no!! That’s not enough… What are you doing?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m getting that baby out of you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no. No-no! I think my water just broke.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I am good. Okay! Okay! Uh, I got the pillow! I got the bag! You got the keys?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! I got the keys! Okay! Okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’re having a baby.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I didn’t uh, really have time to read this part of the books, but do you think we have time to…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not so much.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Two hundred.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s it. I’m done. I don’t care when the baby comes, no more betting.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Okay. I guess we can bet one more time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Is Rachel having the baby?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How did you know that?! Joey! Chandler!! It’s time!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: They’re at the coffeehouse.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know everything!! Oh wait, double or nothing. I bet you the baby is over seven pounds. I bet you it has hair. I bet you it’s a girl.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We know it’s a girl!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll give you really good odds.
